author: Al Weaver
description: President Trump’s “big, beautiful bill” took unfriendly fire from several White House allies Tuesday, including Elon Musk, complicating its path out of the Senate and to the president’s desk. Musk offered stinging criticism of the bill just days after he left the administration, calling it “a disgusting abomination.” “I’m sorry, but I just can’t stand…
title: Trump bill takes unfriendly fire from GOP allies

author: Brooke Migdon
description: President Trump has “no plans” to issue a proclamation recognizing June as Pride Month, or dedicate it to any other group or cause, White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt said Tuesday.  “There are no plans for a proclamation for the month of June,” Leavitt said during a media briefing at the White House, “but I can…
title: White House: ‘No plans’ for Trump to issue Pride Month proclamation

author: Brad Bannon, opinion contributor
description: The Senate will return from recess to consider Trump's "big beautiful bill" which would extend tax cuts for wealthy Americans and large corporations while reducing spending on health care and nutrition programs, despite public opposition and concerns about the national budget deficit.
title: Trump’s tax and spending bill faces Senate scrutiny amid public discontent

author: Rebecca Beitsch
description: Rep. Jasmine Crockett (D-Texas) formalized her bid to lead the House Oversight Committee, pitching herself as a fresh face to take on the GOP majority. Crockett’s dear colleague letter makes her the fourth Democrat to throw her hat in the ring since the death of Rep. Gerry Connolly (D-Va.) last month from cancer. “Our country is in…
title: Jasmine Crockett formally launches House Oversight bid

author: Sandra Sanchez
description: The Department of Homeland Security on Monday announced it is revamping its Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) tip line following a weekend attack in Colorado.
title: DHS revamps ICE tip line with more staff after Colorado attacks

author: Emily Brooks
description: Billionaire Elon Musk ramped up his criticism of the megabill of President Trump’s tax cut and spending priorities, calling the legislation a “disgusting abomination.” “I’m sorry, but I just can’t stand it anymore. This massive, outrageous, pork-filled Congressional spending bill is a disgusting abomination,” Musk posted on X on Tuesday. “Shame on those who voted for…
title: ‘Disgusting abomination’: Elon Musk tears into Trump megabill

author: Julia Manchester
description: Sen. Cory Booker (D-N.J.) endorsed former Virginia Del. Jay Jones (D) for the state’s attorney general on Tuesday ahead of the primary this month, becoming the latest national Democrat to wade into Virginia’s down-ballot races this year.  “Jay Jones will be a tireless fighter for Virginia families as Attorney General, and that’s why I’m so…
title: Booker wades into Virginia attorney general race

author: Ellen Mitchell
description: The Pentagon plans to move its oversight of Greenland from U.S. European Command to U.S. Northern Command, a switch that would bring the Denmark-aligned island closer to alignment with the United States. The change, first reported by Politico, comes as President Trump has repeatedly expressed an interest in taking control of the autonomous territory, where the…
title: US shifting Greenland military oversight in ownership push

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: A man claiming to be one of the two New Orleans jail escapees at large has posted videos on social media pleading for help from celebrities and asking for justice.
title: Escaped Louisiana inmate pleads for Trump’s help in video

author: Gregory J. Wallance, opinion contributor
description: Trump cannot grasp that his fundamental problem is with the Constitution, not the judges. His executive orders are too much for some of his own judicial appointees.
title: The Constitution strikes back against Trump

author: The Hill Staff
description: White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt will brief reporters Tuesday afternoon as pressure grows on President Trump over his tariff moves and whether the U.S. will add additional sanctions on Russia amid the war in Ukraine. Last week, a federal judge ruled that Trump did not have the unilateral authority to implement his sweeping tariffs…
title: Watch live: White House holds briefing amid pressure over Trump tariffs, Ukraine peace talks

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Joe Walsh, a former Republican member of Congress, said Tuesday he is becoming a Democrat, marking the end of his five-year streak as a political independent after leaving the GOP in 2020. Walsh announced his formal affiliation with the Democratic Party in a Tuesday Substack post, saying he made the decision because he views the…
title: Joe Walsh says he’s becoming a Democrat

author: Josh DuBose
description: Officials at the United States Embassy and its consulates in Mexico have confirmed several reports of Americans being kidnapped by individuals they met on a dating app, federal officials announced.
title: US citizens kidnappings in Mexico tied to dating apps, officials warn

author: Sierra Campbell
description: Out of 145 rice samples nationwide, 100% of them tested contained arsenic.
title: Lead, arsenic found in popular rice brands: Study

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Officials in North Macedonia said Monday it would abolish all tariffs on imported U.S. goods in an effort to have President Trump adopt the same trade measure. “By unilaterally reducing customs rates, we are sending a message to accelerate the process of reciprocity in a mutual trade exchange,” Finance Minister Gordana Dimitrieska Kochoska told reporters,…
title: North Macedonia abolishing tariffs on US goods

author: Joe Kane, opinion contributor
description: The BEAD program has a strong fiber bias, which is costly and inefficient, and states should consider using more cost-effective technologies to extend deployment and use the savings to help low-income households get online.
title: We’re trading centuries of Internet access for one more mile of fiber

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: Sen. Joni Ernst faced backlash for her sarcastic apology video after making insensitive remarks about Medicaid cuts and death at a town hall, with political analysts David Axelrod and Scott Jennings agreeing that her video was not wise.
title: Axelrod: Ernst response to Medicaid remarks ‘insensitive,’ ‘politically stupid’

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Ukrainian officials said Tuesday they struck a bridge that connects Russia to Crimea with underwater explosives.  The Security Service of Ukraine (SBU) detonated incendiaries at 4:44 a.m. local time and continued to strike the area for three hours, using 1,100 kilograms of explosives to hit the overpass used as a supply route by Russian forces.…
title: Ukraine says it has struck bridge connecting Russia to Crimea with underwater explosives

author: Lexi Lonas Cochran
description: The Texas legislature passed a bill on Monday that would give state boards appointed by the governor more power over universities’ curriculum, sending the legislation to Gov. Greg Abbott’s (R) desk.   Governing boards at higher education institutions, which are appointed by the governor, will be able to review and strike down general curriculum requirements…
title: Texas bill changing control of higher ed curriculum goes to governor’s desk

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: Former New York Governor Andrew Cuomo regrets resigning in 2021 amid sexual harassment allegations and is now running for mayor of New York City, despite facing backlash for his pandemic-era policies.
title: Cuomo says he shouldn’t have resigned as NY governor

author: Alexander Bolton
description: Sen. Josh Hawley (R-Mo.), who has pushed back against a House proposal to reduce Medicaid spending by hundreds of billions of dollars, says President Trump told him on Monday that the final bill encompassing his domestic agenda will not include any cuts to Medicaid benefits. “Just had a great talk with President Trump about the…
title: Hawley says Trump told him ‘no Medicaid benefit cuts’

author: Rebecca Beitsch
description: A union scored an initial victory in its challenge to stop the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) from stripping collective bargaining rights from employees at the Transportation Safety Administration (TSA). The American Federation of Government Employees (AFGE) argued that Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem has no power to end an already authorized seven-year contract, accusing the secretary…
title: Judge temporarily blocks Noem from killing TSA workers’ collective bargaining deal

author: Merrill Matthews, opinion contributor
description: Congress must reclaim its constitutional authority over tariffs, as President Trump's use of the International Emergency Economic Powers Act (IEEPA) has been deemed unconstitutional, and a court ruling could lead to a Supreme Court decision on the matter.
title: Congress should grow a backbone and reclaim tariff authority

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: Calley Means, a top adviser to Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr., defended the findings of the MAHA report despite its flaws, and highlighted the need to stop the government from subsidizing ultraprocessed foods.
title: MAHA adviser: Report’s citation errors ‘great disservice’ to Trump, RFK Jr.

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: President Trump pardoned two Florida divers convicted of theft after they freed 19 sharks and a grouper from a longline near the Florida coast. John Moore Jr., the captain of a shark-diving charter boat, and Tanner Mansell, a crew member, spotted what they believed to be an illegal fishing line approximately 3 miles from the…
title: Trump pardons Florida divers who freed sharks

author: Julia Manchester
description: Virginia Gov. Glenn Youngkin (R) announced on Tuesday that the special election to replace the late Rep. Gerry Connolly (D-Va.) in the state’s 11th Congressional District will be held on Sept. 9.  The news comes weeks after Connolly died last month after a short battle with cancer. He had represented the district since 2009. Prior…
title: Youngkin sets September special election to replace Connolly

author: Donna Brazile, opinion contributor
description: A new era is beginning for Democrats.
title: The Democrats’ new campaign agenda: No more Mister Nice Guy

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: The acting head of the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) was joking when he said he was not aware the U.S. had an official hurricane season, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), which houses FEMA, said in a statement. The acting head of the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) was joking when he said he…
title: FEMA chief was joking with hurricane season awareness remarks: DHS

author: Gabriel Noronha, opinion contributor
description: Unless the Senate takes action to fix this legislation, the American taxpayer will be on the hook for funding our foremost adversary.
title: End US tax breaks that enrich Chinese companies

author: Lexi White
description: By the time rescue crews from other areas responded to the scene, the plane had fully submerged, according to local fire officials.
title: 2 rescued after plane crashes into ocean off coast of Connecticut
